intro: Alatiglossum barbatum, commonly known as the hairy lip plant, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, lip-shaped flowers that are often brightly colored. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests or along stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its common name. The flowers are borne in clusters and attract a variety of pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
